Base:Descriptions.Base:Description: the backstage private meeting room
This is no longer the backstage. Seriously, get the hell out. +go house or @hop foyer.
The nothing! Go to the House!
This is no longer the backstage. Seriously, get the hell out. +go house or @hop foyer.
http://www.skotos.net/IronclawGame/images/maps/backstage/commons.jpg
archway leading to the east hallway
A long hallway extends to the east through an archway. Looking through here you see:
archway leading to the north hallway
A long hallway extends to the north through an archway. Looking through here you see:
narrow door labeled 'Market Street'
A narrow wooden door sporting a small plaque that reads 'Market Street'.
narrow door labeled 'VP Lounge'
A narrow wooden door with the words 'VP Lounge' set in gold lettering at eye level. You can hear whispering behind the door.
A narrow wooden door with the words 'VP Lounge' set in gold lettering at eye level.
You enter through the west door and a bell rings.
enters through the west door and a bell rings.
archway leading to the south hallway
A long hallway extends to the south through an archway. Looking through here you see:
narrow door to the work area
A narrow door leading into the work area.
A narrow door leading into the work area.
You enter through the south door and a bell rings.
enters through the south door and a bell rings.
a narrow wooden door with a small window that lets in the morning light.
sw
A narrow wooden door with a small window that lets in the morning light. Through the window can be seen a shaded woody area.
archway leading to the west hallway
A long hallway extends to the west through an archway. Looking through here you see:
the ceiling
White plaster is used to form the ceiling; water stains are here and there. Thrifty torch sconces provide subtle lighting.
the northeast corner
The northeast corner of the room.
the northwest corner
The northwest corner of the room.
the southeast corner
The southeast corner of the room.
the southwest corner
The southwest corner of the room.
the floor
The floor is made from smooth oak planks, of various widths. The planks are not entirely evenly laid, and some have warped slightly, so that the floor is a bit uneven.
the dammit
The dammit is seen.
The dammit is seen.
the middle of the room
The middle of the room.
round blue rug
A blue circular rug with a floral design.
the falling snow
Little crystals of frozen water are falling from the sky. It is called snow.
Yes, snow is falling.
a snowdrift
A drift of snow has piled up near here. Although not large, it may be enough for quite a few well-rounded snowballs.
A drift of snow has piled up near here.
the torches
A group of thrifty torches adorn the walls; set in brass sconces and evenly spaced. The torches flicker with meager light.
the east wall
Carefully panelled oak wainscotting rises to about six feet high on the east wall; cream-colored plaster covers the remainder of the wall, up to the ceiling cornice.
You step through the north wall...
the north wall
Carefully panelled oak wainscotting rises to about six feet high on the north wall; cream-colored plaster covers the remainder of the wall, up to the ceiling cornice.
arrives, merging through the north wall.
merges through the north wall, disappearing from view.
the south wall

Carefully panelled oak wainscotting rises to about six feet high on the south wall; cream-colored plaster covers the remainder of the wall, up to the ceiling cornice. Hanging central to this wall is a large framed portrait of Azrael.
the west wall
Carefully panelled oak wainscotting rises to about six feet high on the west wall; cream-colored plaster covers the remainder of the wall, up to the ceiling cornice.
the walls
The elegant walls are made of carved oak panelling, gold leaf, cream-colored plaster and gleaming paint.
the weather
$[Call(${Allegory:Lib:Weather:DB}, "display_weather");]

Core:Properties.Core:Property: X[M] if (NRefDetail(\$target) == "snowdrift") \{ \$object = Spawn(\$\{Allegory:Props:Seasonal:Winter:Snowball\}); \$object."base:environment" = \$actor; EmitTo(\$actor, "You form a snowball from the drift of nearby snow."); EmitIn(\$actor."base:environment", Describe(\$actor)+" forms a snowball from the drift of nearby snow.", \$actor); return FALSE; \} else \{ return TRUE; \}
